item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 147) to amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions.

latestAction.text: Motion to Discharge Committee filed by Mr. Doggett. Petition No: 109-15. (Discharge petition text with signatures.)

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.fullName: Resident Commissioner Fortuno, Luis G. [R-PR-At Large]

item.text: On 9/20/2006, a motion was filed to discharge the Rules Committee from consideration of H.Res.987 a resolution providing for the consideration of H.R.147. A discharge petition requires 218 signatures for further action. (Discharge Petition No. 109-15: text with signatures.)

item.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Fairness Act of 2005 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to repeal: (1) pension offset provisions applicable to husband's and wife's insurance benefits, widow's and widower's insurance benefits, and mother's and father's insurance benefits with respect to OASDI payments; and (2) windfall elimination provisions with respect to computation of the primary insurance amount of an individual.

item.title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the Government pension offset and windfall elimination provisions.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
